alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 07 at 5:03PM MST until March 07 at 6:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Judith Basin County in central Montana... Cascade County in central Montana... * Until 600 PM MST. * At 502 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Denton to 16 miles west of Cascade, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 246 and 295. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 61, between mile markers 123 and 124, and between mile markers 129 and 139. Highway 87 between mile markers 4 and 10. Highway 89 between mile markers 33 and 71, between mile markers 9 and 10, and between mile markers 72 and 8. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Stanford, Belt, Hobson, Fort Shaw, Black Eagle, Geyser, Fort Shaw, Neihart, Windham, Eden, Sapphire Village, Stockett, Utica, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Ulm, Raynesford, Moccasin and Monarch. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
